title: Why are blue eyes and blonde hair so common in Scandinavians but not Sami people? - Quora

response.answer_text: You have the answer in, for example, Why do Sami people have blue eyes and blonde hair? Blue eyes and Blonde hair are generally considered recessive genes although there are major controversies concerning the inheritance of such genes and sub gene. Let's just say that the theoretical models don’t fit the data very well except in first stage inheritance - nature appears to manufacture a lot more natural blondes than genetic theory predicts. For recessive genes to take a grip on a major population, some degree of Inbreeding at some point in time is necessary, or a particular genetic trait so to say develops at the same time for many persons or remains in a place whereas competing traits go away (for example if a disease killed all persons not having blue eyes, or if blondes were considered cursed in Germany and therefore had to move to Denmark to live happily, etc). Generally among Scandinavians, “super blondes” (meaning almost white-haired blondes) appear to be more common in isolated places such as village areas inland or island areas such as Gotland or Öland, whereas red-haired blondes appear to be more common in the Småland area and Åland island. Cheers!

Cute but rare  Even rares among adults  The Scandinavian and Sami populations are distinctly different and have large variations within them. None of us are related to the knotted ware people who were the first hunter gatherer population of Scandinavia, a people who came from present days Southern France and had dark skin and blue eyes. We Scandinavs are northern germanic and our genetics show that we have had much more contact with surrounding countries in the south while northern swedes are more distinctly germanic. The sami are much more complicated. Genetics indicate that three different groups of them came from Siberia but their language is closely related to Finnish. They tend to be dark haired and brown eyed and have different looks from the finns that they are culturally related to. This is sami rapper Maxida Märak  Lastly, the Finns.
